intro: Pseudoxytenanthera dinhensis, commonly known as the Dinh's false sandalwood, is a rare tropical tree native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
